title: Data & Analytics Graduate Programme (Immediate Start)
description:
Join our Graduate Programme in our Data \& Analytics Practice and become a data pro in one of the most influential careers in the tech industry.
  
Whether it’s navigating the intricacies of data extraction with structured query language (SQL) or designing websites and dashboards, you will gain expertise across Whether it’s navigating the intricacies of data extraction with structured query language (SQL) or creating data visualisation and online dashboards, you will gain expertise across a range of technical areas. Our training will cover business intelligence essentials, like diverse data modelling and warehousing, turning large unstructured data sets into valuable business insights.
  
Explore diverse and exciting roles on client assignments. Develop the skills and tools to forecast, analyse and harness data and learn the fundamentals of business intelligence, data engineering and machine learning.
  
  

About this role
  
Upon joining FDM, you will become an Associate Consultant within our Data \& Analytics Practice and commence your journey by building core capabilities for 6 weeks after which you will develop key skills in a practice\-based learning environment followed by continued practice area learning based on client needs. Engaging in various sprints within FDM's Skill Lab, you'll learn technical and professional skills necessary for your first client assignment. The Skill Lab mirrors real\-world scenarios and client settings, providing hands\-on experience in roles like BI Developer, Robotic Process Automation (RPA) Developer, Data Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, or Data Analyst, with access to continuous upskilling and career development opportunities.
  
  

Where ambition meets opportunity
  
At FDM, we want driven people from diverse backgrounds. Dedicated to your continuous growth, we offer a non\-linear career journey with our Skills Lab helping guide you to the future you want.
  
Your skill set will grow, clients will value your increased expertise and your career will thrive exponentially.
  
It’s a journey packed with exciting opportunities – just seize them!
  
  

What we look for
  
  

You hold a university degree level (bachelor or higher)
  
  

Able to commit to completing our full 2\.5\-year graduate programme
  
  

Strong problem\-solving and analytical skills, paired with great interpersonal and communication skills
  
  

Determination and drive – this means going the extra mile to succeed as an IT Consultant
  
  

Eligibility to work in Hong Kong
  
  

Why join us
  
  

Full\-time employment with a competitive salary
  
  

Work with Hong Kong’s biggest FTSE100 companies across banking and finance, investment banking, fintech, insurance, luxury retail and more
  
  

An initial upskilling course pre\-assignment facilitated by our expert coaches
  
  

Opportunity for entire FDM career journey development with ongoing coaching through our Skills Lab
  
  

Consultant Experience Team dedicated to your wellbeing, health and happiness
  
  

Opportunity to become a leading consultant in one of the most in\-demand tech field
  
  

About FDM
  
FDM powers the people behind tech and innovation. From spotting trends to finding exceptional talent, we're the go\-to and business and technology consultancy for staying ahead.
  
With 30\+ years’ experience, we discover, train, and mentor the free thinkers, the fresh starters, and the hard workers from diverse backgrounds, connecting them with world class businesses. Collaborating with our client partners, we provide the perfect talent precisely when needed and guide our people to make career choices that lead to exponential growth.
  
FDM has 18 centres located across Asia\-Pacific, North America and Europe and has helped successfully launch nearly 25,000 careers globally to date and are a trusted partner to over 200 companies worldwide.
  
  

Dedicated to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
  
FDM Group’s mission is to make tech and business careers accessible for everyone. Our diverse team of 90\+ nationalities thrive on differences, fuels innovation through varied experiences, and celebrates shared successes. As an Equal Opportunity Employer and listed on the FTSE4Good Index, FDM ensures every qualified applicant, regardless of race, colour, religion, or any other status, gets the chance they deserve.

description:

title: Business Analyst
description:
Job Duties
  
  

Engage with various stakeholders to understand, negotiate, and prioritize product requirements in line with our strategic objectives and the agile methodology.
  
  

Utilize usage metrics, desktop research and business impact assessments for prioritization decisions in product and platform development, focusing on feature and component reusability for multiple business use cases.
  
  

Translate business needs into detailed requirements for development teams, formulating user stories and maintaining documentation on our wiki.
  
  

Collaborate with Product Managers and Tech Leads to synchronize product development with sprint goals and timelines.
  
  

Oversee the product development lifecycle, working closely with designers, developers, and QA teams to ensure excellence in quality deliverables for each sprint.
  
  

Develop and manage UAT test cases with business partners, ensuring thorough issue tracking and resolution.
  
  

Handle multiple product initiatives concurrently, maintaining a focus on scalability, integration, and platform building with an emphasis on feature and component reusability.
  
  

Proactively report to the digital product management team, offering insights and updates on product development progress.
  
  

Requirements
  
  

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
  
  

At least 2 years solid platform building experience, with a strong emphasis on feature and component reusability.
  
  

Extensive experience working with Agile teams; Scrum\-related certification holder is a plus.
  
  

Proficiency in oral and written English, Cantonese, and Mandarin Chinese.
  
  

Capability to collaborate effectively with in\-house and vendor development teams across Hong Kong, Mainland China, the United States, and India in an agile environment.
  
  

Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail and the ability to adapt to agile methodologies.
  
  

Excellent communication and negotiation skills for managing stakeholder expectations.
  
  

Experience in crafting user stories for both front\-end and back\-end systems, including non\-functional requirements with considerations of system scalability, security, and performance under heavy load.
  
  

Ability to manage multiple product initiatives with strong organizational and time\-management skills while embracing agile practices.
  
  

Must be able to work on\-site in Hong Kong.
  
  

All applications applied through our system will be delivered directly to the advertiser and privacy of personal data of the applicant will be ensured with security.
  
  

Full\-time

title: Leave Data & System Analyst (13 months contract)
description:
Cathay Pacific
Administrative \& Operational Support
Inflight Service Delivery Department
Permanent
Hong Kong SAR (China)
Application deadline: 12 Sep 2025
**Role Introduction**
---------------------

**Reports to:** Assistant Manager Leave Services



The Lead Data \& System Analyst sits under the Inflight Service Delivery Department mainly responsible for supporting the digital and data analytics ambition and lean initiatives of the Well\-being \& Leave Support Team (“WLST”) that will enable an efficient and streamlined service and administration of all types of leave; supporting the Well\-being \& Leave Support Manager and Head of Cabin Crew in generating actionable quantitative statistics and insight to support decision making for all matters pertaining to Inflight Service Delivery cabin crew team.

**Key Responsibilities**
------------------------

**Digital/Systems Development:**


* Recommend and develop new digital processes to improve service quality and
  

process efficiencies; and liaise with the Information Technology department, Inflight Service Delivery – Planning team and any other business units to implement quality metrics, ensuring accessibility and consistency of data and readiness of related analytics capabilities
* Assume the role of subject matter expert on all WLST programs e.g. CAMS, iClaims, POINTS, case management tools and any other supplementary programs necessary for the day to day function of the WLST. In relation to this, the Leave Data \& Systems Analyst is to participate in all solution discussions, evaluate and propose solution approaches and test all solution aspects including, but not limited to, acceptance and performance integration


**Data Analysis and Attendance Related Matters**


* Responsible for the production and maintenance of all WLST related statistics
  

e. AMP and PAMS statistics, work injury related statistics, leave, unpaid leave
  

and ad hoc leave statistics
* Assist in evaluating data collected from Group Safety and Operational Risk
  

Management team and work injury management service provider and provide in
  

depth analysis of behavioural trends of cabin crew incurring work injury and how
  

this is connected to lost time injury
* Identify specific behaviours based on various statistics and keep track of all development concerning cabin crew such as new routes, new service procedures, new or changes to lifestyle schemes, public holiday schedules or political environment, track changes such as peaks and troughs in absence statistics and trends and make recommendation to Well\-being \& Leave Support Manager on strategies to curb and address work injury cases and sick leave
  

cases
* Serve as Well\-being \& Leave Support Team resident expert on Qliksense and
  

Alteryx for data analysis; manage enhancements on data and tools to advance
  

analytical power, including analytics requirement and testing, prepare training
  

material and delivery


**Leave Management**


* Administer and arrange all cabin crew leaves (e.g. annual leave, maternity
  

leave, sick leave, compassionate leave, unpaid leave etc.)
* Support and facilitate cabin crew ad\-hoc leave requests due to compassionate reasons as and when required; and supervise and facilitate the allocation of ground duties to cabin crew taking up maternity ground duties; and ensure all leave support services meet service standards


**Cabin Crew Crisis and Incident Management And Other Support**


* Support Inflight Service Delivery teams during crisis or incidents; and participate in E\& A activities as required
* Carry out any other tasks and duties as required by Head of Cabin Crew
  

and/or Well\-being \& Leave Support Manager; and deputise Assistant Manager Leave Services when required

**Requirements**
----------------

* Diploma or above
* Knowledge of cabin crew policies and procedures and an understanding of cabin crew culture
* Knowledge of relevant ordinances and best practices to ensure legal and
  

contractual compliance
* Prior experience in using analytics tools, visualization tools, SQL, reporting tools
  

and database management concepts an advantage
* Team player with strong communication, customer and interpersonal skills
* Curious, meticulous, self\-motivated and strong continuous improvement mind
  

set
* Willingness to embrace change
* Good project coordination skills
* Strong analytical, fact\-finding and decision making skills

**Personal \& Application Information**
---------------------------------------


Cathay Pacific is an Equal Opportunities Employer. Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with our Applicant Personal Information Collection Statement and for recruitment purposes only. Candidates not notified within eight weeks may consider their application unsuccessful. We keep records of your data for no longer than is necessary for the purpose for which we obtained them and any other permitted linked purposes. If your application is unsuccessful, we will keep your details on file for as long as is necessary to process your application or for the purposes of further job opportunities if you agree to such longer periods.

title: Senior Analyst, Campaign Marketing and Sponsorship
description:
Job Description:
**Responsibilities:**

**Customer campaign**

* Assist in implementing customer campaign both from corporate and channel perspective to improve customer satisfaction and drive business sales
* Work with internal and external work streams to launch programme in timely and effective manner within budget
* Coordinate and support the production of marketing / promotion materials
* Handle distributors enquiry
* Monitor campaign budget and expenses
* Being responsible for campaign fulfilment to eligible customers/ distributors
* Prepare programme tracking report and prepare analysis based on the results
* Conduct market research and prepare competitive analysis

**Customer management programme**

* Assist in executing the event\-trigger contact programme to enhance customer experience and generate new sales opportunities
* Monitor programme budget and expenses, as well as programme results

**Customer events and sponsorship**

* Support the implementation of customer events or sponsorship (e.g. concerts, carnivals, sports and art events etc.)
* Manage and communicate with external parties (joint promotion partners, merchants, agencies) in a professional manner
* Coordinate and support the production of marketing / promotion collaterals

 **Qualifications:**

* University graduate or equivalent
* 2\-3\+ year of marketing experience, preferably in insurance, banking or financial institutions
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Strong analytical skill and good business senses
* Attention to details, well\-organized, self\-initiative and result\-oriented
* A good team player
* Good project management experience
* Sensitive to data with strong analytical mind
* Experience in client promotions is highly preferred
* Strong PC skills especially PowerPoint, Excel and Chinese Word Processing

 **About AXA Hong Kong and Macau**

  

AXA Hong Kong and Macau is a member of the AXA Group, a leading global insurer with presence in 50 markets and serving 95 million customers worldwide. Our purpose is to act for human progress by protecting what matters.

  

As one of the most diversified insurers in Hong Kong, we offer integrated solutions across Life, Health and General Insurance. We are the largest General Insurance provider and a major Health and Employee Benefits provider. Our aim is to not only be the insurer to provide comprehensive protection to our customers, but also a holistic partner to the individuals, businesses and community we serve. At the core of our service commitment is continuous product \& service innovation and customer experience enrichment, which is achieved through actively listening to our customers’ needs and leveraging and investing in technology and digital transformation.

  

We embrace our responsibility to be a driving force against climate change and a force for good to create shared value for our community. We are proud to be the first to address the importance of mental health through different products and services and thought leading iconic research. Our overall Sustainability Strategy, with emphasis on climate strategy and biodiversity commitment, is developed based on TCFD recommendations. We are committed to integrating environmental, social and governance factors across our business and strive to contribute to a sustainable future through 3 distinct roles \- as an investor, an insurer and an exemplary company.

  

AXA is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to promoting Diversity and Inclusion (D\&I) by creating a work environment where all employees are treated with dignity, respect, and where individual differences are valued. We welcome and treasure diverse profiles to join our big family, and to build an inclusive culture together which allows everyone to maximise their personal potential.

  

Our people strategies are designed to enhance employee well\-being and professional growth, ultimately empowering them to excel within the company.


Click here to learn more about our Benefits (https://www.axa.com.hk/en/benefits) , Culture (https://www.axa.com.hk/en/culture\-and\-values), \& Career Development (https://www.axa.com.hk/en/career\-development).

title: Data Analyst
description:
**Data Analyst**
================

**Job summary**
---------------



You will be working closely with Sales and Marketing team, Product team and Business Performance team to perform quantitative data analysis on business performance. You will utilize advanced analytics, segmentation, and modeling techniques to deliver actionable intelligence and deep insights across our customer base. By unraveling customer characteristics, behaviors, propensity, and value, you will play a vital role in driving strategic decision\-making.

  


**Your role**
-------------


* Identify and execute data analytics initiatives to continuously enhance our understanding of customer behaviors and trends across businesses and brands, aligning with business objectives.
* Utilize your expertise in coding and programming to perform data transformations and mine large datasets, extracting meaningful insights that drive decision\-making, addressing complex and unstructured business questions through quantitative problem\-solving.
* Apply cutting\-edge data mining and predictive modeling techniques to analyze customer segmentation and behavior, with a focus on cross\-selling, retention, engagement, and growth.
* Monitor day\-to\-day business activities closely, identifying potential risks and opportunities that drive meaningful business impact.
* Build and maintain comprehensive reports and interactive dashboards that provide actionable intelligence to stakeholders across the organization.
* Collaborate with IT teams to drive the long\-term development of business intelligence solutions and leverage innovations in Cloud, Big Data, and AI technologies.

  


**To succeed in this role**
---------------------------


* University degree holder in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
* 1 year of proven experience as a Data Analyst with a focus on pattern recognition and data analysis is preferred
* Proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation, transformation, modelling, and analysis.
* Strong knowledge of statistical methods and modelling techniques.
* Experience with data visualization tools, such as Tableau, Qlik Sense, or similar.
* Familiarity with cloud solutions, such as AWS, GCP and BigQuery, is a plus.
* Excellent analytical and problem\-solving skills.
* Strong analytical, business acumen, problem\-solving and inter\-personal skills
* Capable of work effectively and efficiently, and work well under pressure
* Excellent command of written and spoken English and Chinese
* ***Fresh graduates will also be considered.***

title: Pricing Analyst
description:
Job Location: Asia Pacific Country


Key Responsibilities:


Bid Management:

* Support the Gatekeeper from pre\-bid to post bid on nominated Ocean Freight opportunities.
* Manage incoming RFQ’s and work together with all stakeholders in preparing, finalizing and delivering a timely and winning tender response
* Engage with country teams and regional pricing teams to ensure all bid responses are checked \& validated for accuracy, adherence to customer’s requirements
* Translation and execution of CPT\-IPT\-CPT
* Evaluate country pricing to bid and benchmark against comparative bid data, so as to optimize customer pricing effectiveness
* Develop and maintain strong connections with internal customers such as Commercial Owner/ Industry Sector heads (Life Sciences and Healthcare, Chemicals, Automotive, Engineering \& Manufacturing, Energy, Technology, Consumer and/or Retail), and Product\-Management...etc.
* Follow up on submitted RFQs with CO and Lead Gatekeeper of the bid outcome and lesson learned
* Understand the complexity of customer’s requirements such as ocean transportation, sector specific knowledge, IT customer solutions etc.
* Support and document online sourcing activates directly with the countries
* Support and development of technical narratives related to Ocean Freight Solutions

  

Sanity Check \& Review:

* Check of internal consistency with guidance/Pricing Instructions
* Challenge pricing as necessary with CT OCC
* Support on subsequence rounds, analytic \& final offers
* Validation with regional/countries as needed
* Analysis to support walk\-away decision


Support Continuous Improvement Processes:

* Shorten turn\-around times \& improve quality
* Work with Regional Ocean Freight teams to facilitate and enable competitive and differentiating Ocean Freight pricing solutions
* Others: As needed/required by Regional Ocean Freight Product.


Stakeholder: External

* Guidance of account owners to provide relevant data and PI as basis for pricing instructions
* Proactive preparation on RFQ launch instructions and align with Commercial Owners \& Lead Gatekeeper on Ocean Freight RFQ approach

  

Required Skills/Abilities:

* Degree holder or related subject experience
* Knowledge of Ocean Freight forwarding business and understanding of supply chain logistics will be advantage
* Minimum 3 years ocean product related experiences
* Operations experience in a complex global environment
* Strong people and communication skills
* Effective time management with problem solving and decision\-making skills
* Proven ability to work independently and as a good team player
* Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Excel
* Good command of English and Mandarin with both written and spoken
* Candidate with more experience will be considered as Senior Pricing Analyst

 **Personal Information Collection Statement pertaining to Recruitment**


DHL Global Forwarding (Hong Kong) Limited (“DHL”) is committed to protecting and respecting your privacy in accordance with the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance of Hong Kong (the “Ordinance”) and DHL’s Personal Data Protection Policy (the “Policy”) at http://www.dhl.com.hk/en/legal.html\#pdpp


By proceeding to respond to this recruitment advertisement you consent that we may use, retain, process, transfer or otherwise handle the personal data that we collect from you for recruitment purposes (including any other purposes directly related thereto) in accordance with the Policy.

  

All personal data of unsuccessful applicants will be retained for future recruitment purposes for a period of not more than six (6\) months, after which such data will be destroyed.

  

You have the right at any time to make a data access or correction request concerning your personal data held by us. In addition, you may request us to delete your personal data that is no longer required for the relevant purposes which you have given consent. Should you wish to exercise such rights or have any question in relation to your personal data or the Policy, please contact our Human Resources Department.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Asia Allied Infrastructure Holdings Limited (”Asia Allied infrastructure”, “AAI” or “the Group”; stock code: 00711\.HK) was founded in 1968, operating construction engineering business initially. In 1993, AAI was listed on the Main Board of The Stock Exchange of Hong Kong. Since then, the Group has entered the mainland Chinese and overseas markets and expanded its scope of business into property development and investment, security services and property management, non\-franchised bus services and other sectors. After years of hard work and rapid development, the Group has over 6,000 employees now.
  
  

**Job Description:** We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our team in the Construction industry. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing construction\-related data to provide insights that drive decision\-making and improve project outcomes. This role requires a strong analytical mindset, proficiency in data analysis tools, and a deep understanding of construction processes and metrics.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Lead data projects from inception to completion, including planning, execution, and delivery.
  
  

Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources including project management software, financial systems, and field reports.
  
  

Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) such as project timelines, budget adherence, resource allocation, and safety metrics.
  
  

Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to identify data\-driven opportunities.
  
  

Use predictive modelling and forecasting techniques to anticipate project risks and opportunities.
  
  

Conduct ad\-hoc analyses to support business initiatives.
  
  

Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and construction management.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
  
  

At least 6 years relevant experience in data analysis.
  
  

Proven experience as a Data Analyst.
  
  

Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Python, R, SQL, and Excel.
  
  

Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
  
  

Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills.
  
  

Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  
  

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  
  

Demonstrated experience in leading data projects and managing stakeholders.
  
  

**Preferred Qualifications:**  

Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
  
  

Experience with machine learning and predictive modelling.
  
  

Knowledge of big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or similar.
  
  

Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
  
  

We offer competitive remuneration package with comprehensive fringe benefits to the right candidates:
  
  

* Birthday Leave / Marriage Leave / Paternity Leave / Examination Leave
* Staff Care Programme
* Career Development Programme


Contact us
  
  

Qualified candidate, please email your full resume with academic credentials, working experience, expected salary and availability by clicking the "apply now" button as below.

**Responsibilities:**

title: Investment Analyst
description:
We are seeking a talented individual to join our Wealth team at Mercer. This role will be based in Hong Kong. This is a hybrid role that has a requirement of working at least three days a week in the office.
  
  

**We will count on you to:**  

Assist in client’s portfolio management analysis, including asset allocation, investment manager selection, fund performance, risk and attribution analysis, leveraging Mercer’s proprietary analytics tools, internal databases and third party resources.
  
  

Support the full cycle client projects through independent research, data analysis applying relevant methodologies, drafting written reports, preparing proposals and attending client meetings.
  
  

Contribute to projects through effective management of tasks, and directly lead some smaller client deliverables.
  
  

Prepare marketing materials and assist in researching complex inquiries. Support business development initiatives and proposals.
  
  

Initiate and lead implementation of ideas that will improve the efficiency, accuracy, controls in relation to assigned work or projects.
  
  

**What you need to have:**  

Ideally 1 year of experience; fresh graduate will also be considered.
  
  

Good academic track record, preferably in subjects such as Mathematics, Finance (Accounting/ Management/ Behavioural), Actuarial Sciences or Engineering.
  
  

Being CFA or close to completing the charter, or other professional qualification preferred.
  
  

Strong knowledge in various asset classes and fund products highly desirable.
  
  

Strong analytical and technical skills. Comfortable with conducting complex comparative analysis with large data sets in an efficient manner.
  
  

Attention to detail, organized and ability to multi\-tasks.
  
  

Self\-initiative and curiosity in investment services and financial markets, self\-motivated to seek out knowledge, test ideas and ways to contribute to the team.
  
  

Proficient with Excel, Powerpoint and Bloomberg. VBA, Python or other programming language a plus.
  
  

Strong written and verbal skills in English and Cantonese. Mandarin would be a plus.
  
  

**Why join our team:**  

We help you be your best through professional development opportunities, interesting work and supportive leaders.
  
  

We foster a vibrant and inclusive culture where you can work with talented colleagues to create new solutions and have impact for colleagues, clients and communities.
  
  

Our scale enables us to provide a range of career opportunities, as well as benefits and rewards to enhance your well\-being
  
  

**Mercer, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE:** MMC), is a global leader in helping clients realize their investment objectives, shape the future of work and enhance health and retirement outcomes for their people. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit mercer.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.
  
  

Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
  
  

Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office\-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.
  
  

All applications applied through our system will be delivered directly to the advertiser and privacy of personal data of the applicant will be ensured with security.
  
  

Full\-time

title: Senior Risk Assurance Analyst (18 months contract)
description:
Cathay Pacific
Financial \& Legal Services
Financial Services Department
Contract
Hong Kong SAR (China)
Application deadline: 11 Sep 2025
**Role Introduction**
---------------------

**Reports to** **:** Risk Assurance Manager



The Senior Risk Assurance Analyst sits under the Finance Customer Lifestyle team in the Financial Services Department, mainly responsible for looking after loyalty fraud, data governance, regulatory compliance and, risk assessment and business contingency in Cathay’s Customer Relationship and Retail (CRR) department.

  



This is a great opportunity to join our Finance Lifestyle team for candidates with internal audit, forensic, or consultancy experiences. You will be responsible for executing daily loyalty fraud detection exercises to identify patterns and activities related to suspicious behaviour.

**Key Responsibilities**
------------------------

**Loyalty Fraud**


* Execute daily loyalty fraud detection exercises (including the usage of relevant data analytic tools) to identify patterns and activities related to suspicious behaviour
* Enforce and evaluate procedures for prevention and mitigation measures
* Provide recommendation for loyalty fraud detection and liaise with relevant  

stakeholders
* Prepare relevant reports for the Membership Fraud Task Force when required and compile supporting documents and data
  


**Data Governance**

  

* Support the execution of data governance framework, policies,  

and guidelines
* Identify and recommend measures and controls related to data governance
* Provide management reporting and administrative support to the data governance function


**Other exposure in Regulatory Compliance and Risk Assessment**


* Keep abreast of and monitor developments in Cathay’s membership program to identify potential loyalty fraud compliance issue and assess their impact on the business
* Maintain Cathay’s membership program risk register

**Requirements**
----------------

* Bachelor’s degree holder preferably in Professional Accountancy or  

Business related fields
* Minimum 3 \- 4 years of experience in internal audit, forensic, or consultancy related area
* Excellent Excel, PowerPoint and presentation skills, and the ability to organise  

materials and data. Experience with data analytics and business intelligence tools will be an advantage
* Knowledge of data governance and risk management is preferred, but not mandatory.
* Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) credential is preferred, but not mandatory
* Good team player with strong communication and interpersonal skills, and  

the ability to work effectively with a variety of stakeholders and to build strong  

relationships across the organisation
* Fluent in English and Chinese
* Candidate with more experience will be considered as Assistant Risk Assurance Manager

**Personal \& Application Information**
---------------------------------------


Cathay Pacific is an Equal Opportunities Employer. title: 2025 APAC Career4Corp Challenge – Corporate Analyst Development Program (Hong Kong)
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION** **2025 APAC Career4Corp Challenge – Corporate Analyst Development Program (Hong Kong)**


Join the 2025 APAC Career4Corp Challenge in Hong Kong, where you'll collaborate with peers to solve real\-world business cases, enhancing your skills in analytics and process improvement. Apply now to embark on a transformative career journey!

**Job summary**


As a participant in the 2025 APAC Career4Corp Challenge – Corporate Analyst Development Program (Hong Kong), you will be encouraged to develop creative ideas to solve a business case alongside other like\-minded students. This Career4Corp Challenge is scheduled for **Friday, 26th September, 2025\.** It is an exciting, collaborative and interactive event that will give you exposure to a realistic business case and will also help prepare you for the assessment center and beyond. You will gain a better understanding of the actual business scenarios that the firm faces in the operation space.


By participating in the event, you will also have the chance to be prioritized in the 2026 Corporate Analyst Development Program Summer (CADP) Internship Assessment Center. The CADP Internship Program is a 9\-weeks program designed to develop your foundational skills within one of our lines of business or corporate functions, in one of three core business disciplines: Analytics, Project Management and Process Improvement.


Participants will be attending the event in\-person and will require a personal laptop/desktop to participate.

**Job responsibilities**

* Work alongside like\-minded individuals with a strong passion in operations, data analytics and process improvement
* Develop a solution as a group for a business case distributed on the event day

**Required qualifications, capabilities and skills**

* Expected graduation date of December 2026 through June 2027 from bachelor's or master's program
* A well\-rounded academic background
* Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
* Relevant internship experience and demonstrated leadership in a school or community organization
* Excellent problem\-solving skills and an ability to thrive in ever changing environments
* Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills
* A team player who is proactive, responsive, and can thrive in a fast\-paced, collaborative environment
* Aptitude to digest large amounts of information while using it to develop innovative solutions with strong attention to detail
* A desire to participate in a rotational program across all lines of business
* Enthusiasm for financial services

**How to apply?**

* Complete the online application **by Sunday, 14****th** **September, 2025, 11:59 PM SGT/HKT**
* Submit a complete and thoughtful application including your resume and a cover letter outlining why you are interested in participating in Career4Corp
* Only shortlisted students will be notified on a rolling basis via email with final event details and the assigned groupings
* As the program is highly competitive, we strongly encourage that you apply and complete these application as soon as possible

**Join us**


JPMorgan Chase is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that respects all people for their unique skills, backgrounds and professional experiences. We strive to hire qualified, diverse candidates, and we will provide reasonable accommodations for known disabilities.


Visit jpmorganchase.com/careers for upcoming events, career advice, our locations and more.


**Reasonable Adjustments**

J.P. Morgan is an inclusive employer of choice. If you require any adjustments to enable you to perform the essential functions of your job, please do not hesitate to contact your recruiter.


For enquiries, please email us at apac.corporate.campus.recruitment@jpmorgan.com.




**ABOUT US**  

JPMorganChase, one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.  

  

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.

  

  

  

**ABOUT THE TEAM**  

  

Our professionals in our Corporate Functions cover a diverse range of areas from finance and risk to human resources and marketing. Our corporate teams are an essential part of our company, ensuring that we’re setting our businesses, clients, customers and employees up for success.

title: Business Analyst, Research, IT
description:
**Position Description**


This is a unique opportunity for a Business Analyst with experience in Research and Events management development to drive innovation and shape the future of our Research platforms.


**Key Areas of Responsibilities**


* Work with the Events team and other Research and Sales staff to identify product requirements and create and own the product roadmap for Forums platforms.
* Business analysis of user\-friendly and efficient events systems, ensuring they align with business objectives and customer needs.
* Work with development teams to ensure features are delivered on time and meet business stakeholder needs.
* Conduct user research and monitor key performance indicators to identify areas for improvement.
* Ensure that the Events platform is integrated with other systems and tools.
* Stay up\-to\-date with industry trends and best practices to drive innovation and improvement.
* Gather requirements, perform process analysis, and analyze data to drive product design.
* Partner with Compliance teams to meet regulatory requirements.
* Work with business to define data administration and document governance.

**Requirements**


* Bachelor/Masters degree in IT or Business
* Around 3 years work experience as a BA or similar role, preferrable with a focus on Events development projects.
* Strong organisational and analytical skills with the ability to communicate complex data and processes clearly.
* Strong working knowledge of SQL to perform data analysis and identify data\-driven solutions.
* Strong understanding of product management, IT solutions, and client portal development.
* Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills, with the ability to use data to inform product decisions.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills in written and spoken English, with the ability to work effectively with stakeholders
* Experience in equity research or related firm wide client portal is a bonus.
* Familiarity with data governance, regulatory, and compliance requirements.
* Self\-motivated and able to thrive in a fast\-paced and dynamic environment.

title: Manager, Operation Risk (Data Analytics)
description:
About FWD Group
FWD Group is a pan\-Asian life and health insurance business that serves approximately 30 million customers across 10 markets, including BRI Life in Indonesia. FWD’s customer\-led and tech\-enabled approach aims to deliver innovative propositions, easy\-to\-understand products and a simpler insurance experience. Established in 2013, the company operates in some of the fastest\-growing insurance markets in the world with a vision of changing the way people feel about insurance. FWD Group is listed on the Main Board of The Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited under the stock code 1828\.
For more information, please visit www.fwd.com
For more information about FWD Hong Kong, please visit www.fwd.com.hk/.
Overview
As the Manager of Operation Risk (Data Analytics), you will be part of the 1\.5 lines of defense within Life Operations (“LO”), supporting both AML and non\-AML regulatory controls through data\-driven risk monitoring and governance. You will lead data analytics initiatives and develop dashboards to strengthen operational resilience, regulatory compliance, and decision\-making across LO.
The Job
1\. Data Analytics* Lead the development and maintenance of management information (“MI”) dashboards and reports to monitor operational risk indicators and strengthen the management oversight
* Lead data extractions, reporting, and analytics within LO to foster a culture of data\-driven decision\-making
* Collaborate with Compliance, Risk, IT, and LO teams (New Business, Life Administration, Claims and Customer Engagement) to align data strategies with operational needs
* Work closely with Quality Assurance Team to identify higher risk areas through data analysis for further checking
* Support risk assessments and incident reviews using data\-driven insights
* Assist in preparing risk and compliance reports for senior management and governance committees
* Translate business requirements into analytical frameworks and actionable insights
* Support regulatory projects and internal and external audits with accurate and timely data analysis


2\. Data Governance* Define and monitor critical data elements (CDEs) to strengthen control processes and support thematic reviews
* Leverage data governance frameworks to ensure data accuracy, integrity, completeness, and security
* Drive initiatives to improve LO data quality and automate reporting processes
* Coordinate with IT and LO teams to ensure operational systems support regulatory requirements and data integrity
* Support ad\-hoc tasks and projects as assigned


The Person* Degree holder in Accounting, Data Analytics, Finance, Information Systems, Risk Management, Statistics, or related disciplines
* Minimum 5–8 years of experience in life insurance operations, compliance, risk management, data analytics or consulting
* Minimum 3 years of experience in data analysis
* Proficiency in data visualization and analytics tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Excel, VBA, SQL, Python)
* Strong understanding of AML controls, regulatory frameworks, and operational risk principles is an advantage
* Experience in data governance, managing regulatory projects, AI and data\-driven risk assessments is a plus
* Analytical and critical thinking with a solution\-oriented mindset
* Strong ownership and ability to work independently
* Confident in working with cross\-functional teams and senior stakeholders with good communication and presentation skills
* Fluent in both written and spoken English and Chinese


We offer 5\-day work, 20\-22 days annual leaves, excellent learning \& development opportunities and an attractive package to the right candidate.
Information collected will be treated in strict confidence and used solely for recruitment purpose. The company will retain all applications no longer than 24 months of which will be destroyed thereafter. When there are vacancies in any of our subsidiaries, holding companies, associated or affiliated companies of, or companies controlled by, or under common control with the Company during that period, we may transfer your application to them for consideration of employment. We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, disability or family status in employment process.

title: Strategy and Planning Analyst
description:
YesStyle.com is a leading global provider of Korean and other Asian cosmetic products in B2C e\-commerce and B2B distribution. With headquarters in Hong Kong and offices in Korea, Japan and Europe, the 25\-year\-old company currently employs a diverse team of over 500 people. YesStyle.com now has several million customers globally with a focus in North America, Europe, and Australia and we are continuing to grow in LATAM and Middle East.
  
  

About the Company
  
  

YesStyle.com is a leading global provider of Korean and other Asian cosmetic products in B2C e\-commerce and B2B distribution. With headquarters in Hong Kong and offices in Korea, Japan and Europe, the 25\-year\-old company currently employs a diverse team of over 500 people. YesStyle.com now has several million customers globally with a focus in North America, Europe, and Australia and we are continuing to grow in LATAM and Middle East.
  
  

**Objective of the Position:**  

As a Strategy and Business Planning Analyst, you will support company business growth and help make data\-driven decisions through identifying business intelligence and opportunities. Communicate business findings and strategic plans to management team and stakeholders across the organization.
  
  

**What You'll Do:**  

Strategic Analysis and Market Research
  
  

Conduct external market research (trends, consumer behaviour, competitive landscape) to identify growth opportunities for Asian beauty brands in global markets.
  
  

Perform competitor benchmarking (pricing, product offerings, marketing strategies) to inform business decisions.
  
  

Support development strategic frameworks (e.g., SWOT, PESTEL, etc.) to evaluate market entry, expansion, and long\-term strategic planning.
  
  

Data\-Driven Business Planning
  
  

Analyze sales, market share, and operational data to support global expansion strategies.
  
  

Support scenario analyses to assess the feasibility of new initiatives (e.g., market entry, price positioning).
  
  

Prepare executive\-level reports and presentations with actionable insights for leadership.
  
  

Cross\-Functional Collaboration
  
  

Provide cross\-functional support for team operations, including inter\-departmental follow\-ups and administrative tasks.
  
  

**What You Have:**  

A university degree in Business Administration, Economics or Marketing discipline, with 2\+ years of work experience.
  
  

**Strong analytical skills:** experience with market sizing, competitive analysis, and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau would be a plus).
  
  

A logical mindset and a can\-do attitude.
  
  

Strong curiosity and a genuine passion for continuous learning.
  
  

Excellent multitasking abilities and attention to detail.
  
  

Good written and verbal communication skills in English.
  
  

Proficiency in computer applications, including Microsoft Office and Excel.
  
  

**What You'll Enjoy:**  

5 Days Work
  
  

Dynamic, International Cultural \& Friendly Working Environment
  
  

Performance Bonus
  
  

Medical / Dental Insurance
  
  

Staff Purchase Discount Program
  
  

Professional Development \& Training Programs
  
  

Team Member's Wellness Programs
  
  

Annual Leave, Full Pay Sick Leave, Birthday Leave, Examination Leave
  
  

**Why YesStyle:**  

Be part of the international company with offices around the globe: Hong Kong, Seoul, Berlin, and Tokyo
  
  

Employee discount on the whole product assortment of YesStyle
  
  

It is now time to find your yes!
  
  

Interested parties please apply by clicking Apply Now with a full resume stating the latest and expected salary.
  
  

All information provided by applicants will be treated in strict confidence and used only for the recruitment purpose in accordance with employer's data policies.
  
  

Full\-time

title: Engineering Research Analyst - precision equipment / electronics / electrical / chemical engineering (Central)
description:
Hong Kong \- Shenzhen \- Guangzhou \- Shanghai \- Beijing
  
  

JPC Texson Ltd, established since 1990, is a Hong Kong and China licensed Employment Consulting firm, specializes in Headhunting and Recruiting Services for companies in Hong Kong and China. We have offices in Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Guangzhou, Shanghai and Beijing.
  
  

About Us
  
  

We are a growing international manufacturer of precision equipment, serving high\-demand sectors such as semiconductors, energy, automotive, electronics, optics, scientific testing, and medical diagnostics.
  
  

With a global workforce of 10,000\+ staff members and manufacturing plants across multiple international locations, we deliver innovative, high\-performance solutions that drive progress for industry leaders.
  
  

Built on a foundation of technical excellence, strategic vision, and sustainable growth, we are shaping the future of high\-tech equipment.
  
  

**Position:** Engineering Research Analyst
  
  

We are seeking a technically strong and strategically minded Engineering Research Analyst to support technology cooperation initiatives—including mergers \& acquisitions (M\&A) and joint ventures (JV)—with a focus on advanced engineering domains.
  
  

This role is ideal for candidates with a solid background in electrical engineering, electronic engineering, chemical engineering, or related disciplines, who are eager to apply their technical expertise to strategic business development.
  
  

Key Responsibilities
  
  

Conduct technical and strategic research on emerging technologies, industry trends, and potential partner companies in high\-tech equipment sectors
  
  

Identify and profile high\-potential companies for technology cooperation (e.g., M\&A, JV), with a focus on engineering innovation and product synergy
  
  

Support early\-stage technical evaluation and preliminary due diligence, including assessment of proprietary technologies, product portfolios, and R\&D capabilities
  
  

Collaborate with internal engineering teams to analyze compatibility of systems, components, and manufacturing processes
  
  

Evaluate potential integration challenges and opportunities from a technical standpoint (e.g., process alignment, IP, engineering talent, production scalability)
  
  

Track project timelines and ensure alignment with both engineering milestones and strategic goals
  
  

Provide engineering\-focused support to the M\&A Director when required, including technical analysis of target companies, review of product and technology fit, documentation of engineering assessments, and participation in strategic discussions related to technology integration and innovation potential
  
  

Participate in internal discussions related to technology partnerships, product development strategy, and long\-term innovation planning
  
  

Business trips are required, including visits to potential partner companies, trade shows, and internal global sites
  
  

Ideal Candidates
  
  

Degree/Master in Electrical Engineering, Electronic Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or a closely related technical field
  
  

Minimum 5 years of experience in high\-tech equipment or systems (e.g., semiconductor manufacturing tools, precision instruments, scientific testing equipment, medical diagnostic equipment, energy systems, chemical processing equipment)
  
  

Strong technical foundation with the ability to understand and evaluate complex engineering systems and emerging technologies
  
  

Experience in technology scouting, technical due diligence, or strategic evaluation is highly desirable
  
  

Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to translate technical insights into strategic recommendations
  
  

Interest in M\&A, JV, and strategic cooperation projects; prior experience is beneficial but not required
  
  

Benefits
  
  

13\-month salary \+ performance bonus
  
  

15 days of annual leave
  
  

Comprehensive medical insurance coverage
  
  

Join us and be part of a forward\-thinking team where your engineering expertise and strategic insight will shape the future of high\-tech innovation on a global scale.
  
  

**TO APPLY for this job or similar jobs :**  

For secure and confidential job application, please click the below link to get our email address.
  
  

http://jpc.hk/confidential\_apply.htm
  
  

JPC Recruiting Services was established in 1990\.
  
  

We provide free job hunting services to job seekers.
  
  

To speed up our process, please do NOT send us download links.
  
  

Personal data provided by job applicants will be used for recruitment purpose only.
  
  

Your privacy is guaranteed. We will never give out, lease, or sell your personal information.
  
  

Full\-time,Permanent

title: AVP/Senior Associate, Data/Business Analytics (Risk and Fraud Analytics under Data Chapter)
description:
As the leading bank in Asia, Transformation and Data (T\&D) supports our management on the implementation of the Group’s agenda. Data Chapter, organized under T\&D, is committed to create synergies between the data analytics functions across the bank, establish centres of excellence, shared services, and reusable data assets, as well as enhance career opportunities and the sense of community for data professionals. Responsibilities: \* Risk Domain Expertise: Apply a solid understanding of credit and/or fraud risk management principles, regulatory requirements, and industry best practices to all analytical endeavors.\* Model Development \& Implementation: Design, develop, validate, and deploy statistical and machine learning models for credit risk assessment, fraud detection, and other related risk analytics applications. This includes data exploration, feature engineering, model selection, training, testing, and performance monitoring.\* Advanced Analytics \& Problem Solving: Apply quantitative and analytical techniques to complex business problems, providing actionable insights and data\-driven recommendations to improve risk management strategies and operational efficiency.\* Machine Learning \& Generative AI Exploration: Actively explore, experiment with, and potentially develop hands\-on solutions utilizing advanced Machine Learning (ML) and/or Generative AI (Gen AI) techniques within the risk domain, identifying opportunities for innovation and enhanced model performance.\* Data Strategy \& Technical Proficiency: Work with large, complex datasets, demonstrating strong technical skills in programming languages (e.g., Python, Spark, SQL) and data manipulation/modeling tools.\* Collaboration \& Communication: Collaborate closely with cross\-functional teams including risk managers, product owners, engineers, and business stakeholders.
  
  

Clearly articulate complex analytical concepts, model methodologies, and findings to both technical and non\-technical audiences through effective presentations and written reports. Requirement: \* Experience: 5\-7 years of hands\-on professional experience in data science, quantitative analytics, or a related field, with a strong focus on credit risk analytics and/or fraud risk analytics within a financial services or relevant industry.\* Risk Modelling Expertise: Solid understanding of risk modelling concepts, statistical modeling, and machine learning algorithms (e.g., logistic regression, decision trees, gradient boosting, neural networks).\* Quantitative \& Analytical Acumen: Strong quantitative and analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights.\* Technical Proficiency: \* Proficiency in programming languages commonly used for data science (e.g., Python).\* Experience with relevant data science libraries (e.g., scikit\-learn, pandas, numpy, TensorFlow, PyTorch).\* Experience with big data platforms (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus.\* ML/Gen AI Interest: Demonstrated hands\-on experience or a strong, proven interest in developing solutions using Machine Learning and/or Generative AI in a risk\-related context.\* Communication \& Presentation Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts and findings clearly and concisely to diverse audiences. Proven ability to create and deliver impactful presentations.\* Problem\-Solving: Exceptional problem\-solving capabilities with a structured and logical approach to tackling complex business challenges.\* Education: A degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Operations Research, or a related discipline is generally preferred. We value practical experience and a strong aptitude for learning as much as formal qualifications.
  
  

Apply NowWe offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Analyst/ Senior Consultant
description:
**About the Business**
----------------------

  

Risk management covers many areas including security and privacy, reputation and control. Our professionals help clients across many industries flag, analyze, evaluate and manage strategic and operational risks while discovering opportunities to create value. If you want to make an impact by helping clients to prevent and manage risk\-related issues while creating significant value to their business this may be your chance.


We help clients address various aspects of strategic risks to their organizations to inform risk\-based strategic choices, prepare to respond to disruption, assess and manage full\-lifecycle enterprise risks, as well as strategize and respond to risks associated with the reliability and protection of data, associated processes and technology. We provide advisory and managed services to help senior executives spot, assess, manage, and respond to risks and/or catastrophic unforeseen incidents that could undermine their competitive position or jeopardize their critical assets, reputation and/or financial standing.


**Work you'll do**
------------------


* Work as a team member to provide high\-quality execution of advisory projects for organizations which receive grant/ funding in public sector, including but not limited to non\-governmental organizations, universities, primary/secondary schools (collectively “Grantees”).
* With reference to standard operating procedures, conduct reviews of financial and operational records, reports and any relevant documents provided by these Grantees, in order to assess compliance with funding body’s terms and conditions.
* Review systems, processes, procedures of Grantees.
* Handle enquiries from Grantees.
* Identify and provide constructive and fit\-for\-purpose recommendations to Grantees for improvement.
* Document the reviews results in an organised manner and draft reports and/or presentation materials with reference to standard templates.
* Support in business development and marketing activities, collaborate with other member firms and service lines within Deloitte.


\#LI\-KTSUI


**We are looking for someone with**
-----------------------------------


* Higher diploma or above in related discipline, e.g. accounting, finance, business.
* 3 – 8 years of experience in accounting, auditing, payment/claim processing, data analysis, or team administration support. Prior experiences in a public sector organization (e.g. non\-governmental organizations) or a professional service firm is an advantage. Candidate with less experiences will be considered as Analyst.
* Good command of both spoken and written English and Chinese. Fluent Cantonese is a must. Good spoken Mandarin is an advantage.
* Reliable and independent team player who have excellent working attitude with high working efficiency.
* Be organized, proactive, self\-motivating and detail\-conscious.
* Have hands\-on experience in Microsoft Office applications and proficiency with Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.
* Be able to handle sensitive and confidential matters in a professional manner.

  




* Job Highlights
* International and Mainland travelling is not required, however travel within HKSAR is required.
* 5 days work, with attractive contract completion gratuity.
* Work\-life balance.
**Shape your future through impact that matters**
-------------------------------------------------

  


For more than 100 years of history, Deloitte witnessed also had the honor to be part of the economic boom in China by providing industry\-leading audit \& assurance, consulting, risk advisory, financial advisory, tax \& business advisory services to nearly 90% of the Fortune Global 500 Chinese companies and thousands of private companies. Deloitte China today carries on our centenary professionalism and strives to become the undisputed leader in professional services in China with strong responsibility and capabilities in digitalization and multidisciplinary services.

  



Deloitte has been named China's Top Employer since 2006, Universum's Most Attractive Employer in China since 2008, and the Best Workplaces in Greater China since 2019\.

  



All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of their background, experience, identity, ability or thinking style, and if you need assistance during the application process for accessibility reasons this is available upon request. The preferred candidate will be subject to background screening by Deloitte China or by their external third\-party provider.

  


**Accessibility assistance**

  

If you need assistance or an accommodation during the recruitment process for accessibility reasons, there will be an opportunity for you to let us know what you need once you begin your application.

  



Ready to take on new challenges? Apply now!

title: Data Analyst (Looker & Self-Service BI Advocate) - HK
description:
Kody, a fast\-growing Fintech specialising in bringing online payments and better financial services to brick and mortar businesses.

### **About the Role**


At Kody, data is at the heart of our decision\-making, and we are looking for a **Data Analyst** who will not only deliver actionable insights but also **empower teams across the business to become more data\-driven**.


In this role, you will be the **internal champion for data analytics and reporting**, ensuring that Looker is fully utilised as our **self\-service BI tool**. You will mentor and train colleagues from multiple departments, helping them become self\-sufficient in accessing and interpreting data. At the same time, you will create and maintain **high\-impact dashboards** that are critical for the business, proactively identifying reporting needs before they arise.


This is an ideal opportunity for someone who enjoys **translating data into business value, enabling others to work effectively with data, and driving a culture of data literacy**.

### **Key Responsibilities**

* **Be the primary advocate for data analytics across the business,** ensuring that Looker is widely adopted and used effectively.
* **Mentor and train colleagues from multiple functions** to use Looker as a self\-service analytics tool.
* **Proactively identify business needs** and create dashboards that deliver actionable insights.
* **Develop, manage, and optimise Looker models, dashboards, and reports,** ensuring they are intuitive and aligned with business objectives.
* **Collaborate closely with stakeholders** to understand key challenges and provide data\-driven recommendations.
* **Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and integrity** within Looker and across reporting structures.
* **Conduct ad\-hoc analyses** to support strategic initiatives and business growth.
* **Stay up\-to\-date with best practices in BI, data visualisation, and analytics** to continuously improve how we work with data.

**Requirements**

* A passionate advocate for data with a strong desire to help others make data\-driven decisions.
* Experienced in Looker (or similar BI tools) and comfortable training and supporting non\-technical users.
* A strong communicator who can translate complex data concepts into actionable insights for business teams.
* Detail\-oriented and proactive, with a mindset for continuous improvement and problem\-solving.
* Proficient in SQL and comfortable working with data at scale. Experience with Python or R is a plus but not required.
* Familiar with data governance, modelling, and best practices to ensure accuracy and consistency.

**Benefits**

* We're a fast growing, exciting company within a rapidly developing industry. You'll be surrounded by super ambitious individuals who think really big.
* Great office locations
* Annual learning and development allowance on training related to your role
* Every year you'll get 25 days of holiday leave plus an extra day of leave for life events like your birthday
* Enhanced parental leave

title: Senior Client Strategy Analyst
description:
The Role
Working closely with the 20th / 21st Century Art Department and global Client Strategy teams, the Senior Client Strategy Analyst will be responsible for researching on the 20th/ 21st Century art market and top collectors, conducting analyses and providing insights, to support business getting and sales targeting for Christie’s global auctions and private sales.  

Specific duties \& responsibilities will include but are not limited to* Conduct in\-depth research and analysis of 20th/ 21st Century art and auction markets in Asia, keep abreast of market happenings and collector activities, and develop insights that are relevant to Christie’s client engagement efforts
* Identify and profile high potential clients, both consignors and bidders, for Christie’s global auctions and private sales
* Work with business getters on building and maintaining their client portfolios, debrief client visits to gather client and object information, help follow up on action points, record strategic information, and maintain interests and wish lists
* Prepare client transaction analyses and reports for key stakeholders and senior management, highlighting key points and implications, and ensure they are available in a timely manner
* Support pre\-sale client targeting, prepare presentation materials and organize sale debriefs, seeking guidance from Client Strategy Manager and utilizing all central applications
* Work hand\-in\-hand with global counterparts in America and Europe to support selling efforts in global 20th / 21st Century art auctions
* Ensure relevant client and objects information is properly recorded, maintained and updated in Christie’s databases, and adhering to corporate data governance framework and guidelines

  

The Candidate* Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree from a recognized University
* 5\+ years of proven experience in an analytical role, preferably with experience in the art market, financial services or management consulting
* Passion for and knowledge of 20th / 21st Century art, strong understanding of key artists and market dynamics would be a plus
* Advanced proficiency in data analysis tools such as Microsoft Excel and data visualization software such as Tableau. Experience in Salesforce would be a plus
* Competent, accurate and proven ability in managing and analysing data
* Attention to detail and able to prioritise, manage time effectively and work under pressure to tight deadlines, whilst keeping an eye on longer\-term projects
* Fluency in English, Cantonese and Mandarin Chinese (verbal and written)
* Strong professional communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to build effective working relationships with department stakeholders
* Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with diplomacy
* A strong customer\-service ethic and to do attitude
* Flexible team player with demonstrable initiative and creativity

title: Data Analyst
company: The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology 香港科技大學
description:
**Job Posting Details**  


The Information Technology Services and Systems Office (ITSO) is responsible for developing, managing, and supporting the University’s IT infrastructure, centralised systems, and administrative applications. Its scope covers finance, human resources, procurement, campus management, admissions, student registration and records, and a wide range of student services. In addition, the office operates and maintains IT services and facilities, while also championing the effective use of technology to enhance learning, research, and administrative activities across the University.  

  

**Job Responsibilities:**  

We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join us. The role will be responsible for dashboards administration and development. This role requires a strong technical background, an analytical mindset, and a proactive attitude toward learning, leveraging, and supporting the latest technologies.  

  

**Job Details:**

* Assist the Manager in managing and participating data warehousing and data analytic project initiatives, including but not limited to data schema design, extract/transform/load (ETL) design, data presentation and visualisation.
* Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
* Work with IT, user department and product owner to build and manage a wide variety of data sets.
* Help planning and executing the development of analytical/machine learning solutions from initial design to model development, model validation, implementation, prototyping and testing.
* Perform other duties as required by the management to support departmental needs.
* Experience in analysing business / data requirements, data gathering, cleansing \& preparation.
* Strong SQL skills and experience working with relational databases.
* Strong data analytical skill and data sense.
* Familiarity with tools, e.g. Tableau, Qlik Sense, Power BI, Informatica, Alteryx, and IBM DataStage.
* Self\-directed with high motivation and demonstrated capability to manage time \& projects and to innovate and explore new techniques.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Degree holder in Computer Science or Business Administration or related discipline.
* 3\-5 years of experience in relevant business intelligence and data analytics, experience in higher education is preferred.
* Candidates with less experience may be considered for appointment of Analyst Programmer.
* Experience in higher education preferred, but not a strict requirement.

*(Duration: 2 years, renewable)*  

  

Starting salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. Fringe benefits including annual leave, medical and dental benefits will be provided. A gratuity will be payable upon successful completion of contract.  

  

**Please apply on or before: 12 September** **2025\.**  

  

*(Information provided by applicants will be used for recruitment and other employment\-related purposes.**Applicants should read the* *Personal Information Collection Statement* *before submission of application.)*

 **HKUST is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to our core values of**  

**inclusiveness, diversity, and respect.**

title: BI Analyst Leader
description:
***Join the Pioneer Crypto Brand in the Philippines!***  

Coins is the most established crypto brand in The Philippines and has gained the trust of more than 18 million users. Through the easy\-to\-use mobile app, users can buy and sell a variety of different cryptocurrencies and access a wide range of financial services.  

Coins is fully regulated by the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas (BSP) and is the first ever crypto\-based company in Asia to hold both Virtual Currency and Electronic Money Issuer licenses from a central bank.### **WHAT YOU WILL DO**

* 1\-Lead business performance analysis across blockchain\-based products, such as trading platforms, wallets, staking, or infrastructure services.
* 2\-Collaborate with Product, Operations, and Growth teams to extract actionable insights that improve user acquisition, engagement, and retention.
* 3\-Build and maintain dashboards, data models, and reports to support business reviews and strategic planning.
* 4\-Track and analyze KPIs across user funnels, transaction behavior, market activity, and product usage.
* 5\-Conduct competitive analysis and market research within the blockchain space to identify trends and innovation opportunities.
* 6\-Serve as a strategic partner, helping product and business teams validate ideas with data and recommend initiatives based on performance metrics.
* 7\-Design and evaluate A/B tests, pricing models, and customer segmentation strategies.
* 8\-Clearly communicate findings and strategy proposals to stakeholders in fluent English, both verbally and in writing.

### **REQUIREMENTS**

* 1\-Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Finance, Data Science, Engineering, or related field.
* 2\-5\+ years of experience in business analysis or strategic analytics, with at least 3 years focused on blockchain or Web3 products.
* 3\-Strong understanding of blockchain product models (e.g., Layer 1/2 networks, on\-chain protocols, smart contracts, tokens).
* 4\-Proficient in data analysis tools: SQL, Excel, and data visualization platforms such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
* 5\-Experience with Python/R for modeling or statistical analysis is a plus.
* 6\-Exceptional English communication skills, with the ability to simplify complex data for executive decision\-making.
* 7\-Comfortable operating in fast\-paced, ambiguous, or decentralized work environments.
* 8\-Demonstrated experience working cross\-functionally with product, engineering, and marketing teams.

***Join the Coins Team Now!*** **Meaningful Collaborations** \- The successful candidate will work cross\-functionally with other relevant teams to carry out implementations that will improve and create an impact on customer experience. **Scalable Growth \-** Be part of a fast\-growing organization with the vision to expand its territories outside APAC which will provide opportunities for career advancement. **A Space For Bright Ideas \-** Let your bright ideas be converted into meaningful changes! Coins culture welcomes new ideas backed up by data to create an impact.

title: Senior Systems Analyst (Data Architect)
description:
**Date:** 25 Aug 2025


**Business Unit:** CCG Group, Chinachem Agencies Ltd, HK, Chinachem

----------------



The job holder is responsible for maintaining the enterprise\-level data platform and data analytics framework, ensuring alignment with Chinachem Group’s standards and governance practices. This role involves close collaboration with other ITS application teams and business units to implement data application projects and support decision\-making through structured data insights.

--------------------


* Maintain the enterprise\-level data platform and analytics framework in line with group standards and governance policies.

----------------
